text:
Hello,
I have a question about the app certification process.
We have our app listed in HubSpot marketplace (you can see it <https://ecosystem.HubSpot.com/marketplace/apps/marketing/analytics-data/whatagraph-201083|here>), and now we would like to get it certified by HubSpot.
When I log in to my HubSpot account and go to App Marketplace -> Listings, I see our app there and also "Certify app" button appears on our app (which, according to info <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/applying-for-app-certification|here> means that our app is eligible to apply).
Next step is to create demo video to submit certification application. And according to information in website video should include:
• A brief overview of your integration
• The installation process and any additional set up steps or requirements
• A walkthrough of the post-installation customer experience, including:
    ◦ Tasks performed
    ◦ Data flowing to and from HubSpot
    ◦ APIs used to push/pull data
    ◦ HubSpot UI components (CRM extensions, timeline events, workflow extensions) your app integrates with or extends
    ◦ The uninstall flow
But our video does not include exactly all information mentioned above (you can see our demo video <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Mf4NsPlphi8|here>).
So my questions would be:
• If I would apply for certification with this video, and application will be rejected - does this mean we will need to wait for 6 months in order to apply again? (because in in minimums certification requirements it is written that: Your app must not have applied for and failed to achieve certification or have triggered any unresolved support escalations in the last six months.)
• If demo video does not include all the information mentioned above - is there any chance to get certified? If no - we would create another video.
Maybe anyone can help with this?

Thanks in advance!

•  I have an issue with a language script that I can’t find. Have any of you run into this issue? On some of my pages, HubSpot is adding ‘?hsLang=ko’ to the end of my URLS, which means the blog options in the footer can’t operate how I need it to: *<https://www.molocoads.com/ko/blog?hsLang=ko|블로그> <https://www.molocoads.com/en/blog?hsLang=ko|EN> | <https://www.molocoads.com/ko/blog?hsLang=ko|KR> | <https://www.molocoads.com/ja/blog?hsLang=ko|JP> — the page redirects EN and JP to KO.* <https://www.molocoads.com/ko/mobile-life-after-lockdown>
